Description: Glazed composition kohl flask in the form of a closed lotus flower; mould-made; dark brown painted decoration on the upper part showing the Egyptian god of infinity, Heh, holding lotus flowers and palm ribs; the lower part shows a lotus flower; inlaid violet and green glaze on a white background; cylindrical upper body with ovoid lower body and pointed base.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.22, Fig 40)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 238)
